properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The following areas set a daily maximum temperature record on September 30, 2020: Port Hardy Area (Port Hardy A) New record of 22.6 Old record of 21.1 set in 2008 Records in this area have been kept since 1944 Sechelt Area (Sechelt Aut) New record of 23.5 Old record of 23.0 set in 1992 Records in this area have been kept since 1956 Note: the temperature records reported here have been derived from a selection of historical stations in each geographic area that were active during the period of record. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-02T09:38:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-01T17:39:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3759884208.2020
Area: Howe Sound
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall possible to start the weekend. Total rainfall: 30 to 50 mm with locally higher amounts possible. Locations: southern Avalon Peninsula. Time span: Friday afternoon to Saturday morning. Remarks: Periods of rain or scattered showers will continue tonight into Friday before heavier rain moves into the area Friday afternoon. Some forecast guidance indicates that total rainfall amounts of 50 mm or more may occur before rain tapers to scattered showers Saturday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-02T10:23:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-01T18:24:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0515333609.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southeast, Avalon Peninsula Southwest
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Waterspout Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of waterspouts. Waterspout development is expected today through Friday afternoon. Waterspouts are most likely over Lake Ontario overnight and Friday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-10-02T06:19:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-01T14:20:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3604736391.2020
Area: Eastern Lake Ontario, Western Lake Ontario
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: southwesterly 100 to 110 km/h. Locations: Nain to Makkovik. Time span: early this morning until this afternoon. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-01T22:59:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-01T08:09:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0752794988.2020
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Waterspout Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of waterspouts. A few waterspouts have been sighted over Lake Erie this morning. Waterspout activity is expected to continue this afternoon and tonight. Some isolated waterspout activity is also possible Friday afternoon and evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-10-02T06:00:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-01T14:01:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3150820595.2020
Area: Eastern Lake Erie, Western Lake Erie
